paper_abstract: The Internet is vulnerable to bandwidth distributed denial-of-service (BW-DDoS) attacks, wherein many hosts send a huge number of packets to cause congestion and disrupt legitimate traffic. So far, BW-DDoS attacks have employed relatively crude, inefficient, brute-force mechanisms; future attacks might be significantly more effective and harmful. To meet the increasing threats, more advanced defenses are necessary.
paper_title: Bandwidth Distributed Denial of Service: Attacks and Defenses
